In his essay "Farewell, Judy; Hello, Madonna" [ June 19 ] , Robert Plunket says he hopes that Judy Garland will someday be rediscovered. Someone should tell him this is happening all the time, proven by current projects in release, which Mr. Plunket glosses over. What's "low-key" about E! doing an hour special on Garland?

A "recordings reissue"? Mr. Plunket neglects to mention that there are four releases coming this summer, including a never-before-released recording of a concert at the Olympia in Paris, a Capitol Records compilation, the soundtrack to "That's Entertainment 3!" and the most ambitious release: a four-CD box set from MCA, "The Complete Decca Masters (Plus)," featuring all 79 of Garland's Decca recordings, along with 11 alternate takes.
For these companies to keep releasing Garland's work, she must still be seen as a success. SCOTT A. SCHECHTER New York GAY ICONS
